title: Bake Off romance: Who are Henry and Alice, the bakers who are just friends?
text:
Henry and Alice made headlines recently over their alleged relationship. (Picture: Instagram)

Henry Bird and Alice Fevronia from The Great British Bake Off are young, talented, funny and appear to have great chemistry, so it’s no wonder they’ve been surrounded by Bake Off romance rumours since the show launched.

However, despite the pictures of the pair hanging out together outside the GBBO tent, any hopes fans had of the contestants actually being a couple – the first ever on the show – have been squashed both by a tongue-in-cheek response from Alice and a source close to the pair categorically denying the rumours.

But who are the GBBO hopefuls who sparked the rumours and what do they do when they’re not sweating it out over the Bake Off stove tops and ovens in the hope becoming Star Baker?

Who are Henry and Alice from Bake Off?

Henry Bird

Henry, who is 20, was inspired to start baking and then apply for GBBO because of, well, GBBO.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The famous baking show once filmed close to his house and it seems that the iconic white tent very much planted a seed in his mind: ‘I would walk past the tent every day, and glimpse the bustle within,’ he reveals. ‘It was only after this that I started baking – Bake Off really has a lot to answer for!’

An English Literature student from Durham University, Henry is also a keen performer who took on the role of Doctor Faustus in a student stage play at his university in November 2017.

After a shaky start, Henry is going from strength to strength in Bake Off (Picture: Channel 4)

He describes his brownie recipe as: ‘the bake I’ve made the most for my housemates at uni’ – making his housemates some of the luckiest on campus, surely.

Henry had a tough start to the competition when his icing house fell down right as he was creating his first fruit cake in the very first week of the competition.

Then, after a wobbly performance on dairy week, Henry admitted he’s been put off baking anything similar in the future: ‘After last week’s carnage let’s be real, there’s no way I’m ever making anything with that much dairy ever again!’

Sorry, this video isn't available any more.

However, things have been looking up for the student, who received a coveted ‘Hollywood Handshake’ last week after his efforts creating festival buns for the signature challenge.

A shocked Henry responded ‘Shut up!’ when the judge extended his hand, then quickly returned Paul Hollywood’s handshake while Sandi and Noel poked fun at the blushing baker.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The witty student also broke hearts during dessert week when viewer spied him wearing a cobweb brooch, which many interpreted as a tribute to his friend, the official queen of spook Helena, who had been eliminated the week before.

Fans were bowled over when they thought GBBO’s Henry was wearing his friend Helena’s brooch (Picture: Channel 4)

Alice Fevronia

Alice, who works in a school for a living and originally hails from Essex, is 28 years old.

The teacher really got into baking when she was 15 and recovering from a back operation for scoliosis which left her unable to go outside and play sport.

Alice is used to being the one handing out scores, not receiving them (Picture: Love Productions/Mark Bourdillon/ Channel 4)

However, the Geography teacher revealed that the real inspiration for her love of baking comes from within the family: ‘I’ve been baking since I was very little and have always loved being creative, but it was my Grandma who inspired me the most.

Alice has been doing well so far in the competition, having nabbed the second Star Baker accolade in week two in the biscuit challenge.

After making her debut on television, the school teacher – who juggled marking papers whilst prepping for each week of the show – took to social media to thank everyone for their support.

‘Feeling a little overwhelmed, but incredibly lucky to be a part of such an amazing experience and go through it with the wonderful bakers I now proudly call my friends,’ she wrote on Instagram after watching the first episode of the new series air on Channel 4.

Advertisement

The Great British Bake Off airs tonight on Channel 4 at 8pm.

MORE: The Greatest Bake Off: Sandi Toksvig makes dig about Henry’s ‘girlfriend’ amid Alice romance rumours
description: Henry Bird and Alice Fevronia have been surrounded by Bake Off romance rumours since the show launched, thanks to their sweet friendship.
